{% set recipe = { title: "Ham & 3-cheese muffins", img: "ham-and-3-cheese-muffins.jpg", preptime: "10 mins", preptimeschema: "10M", prepadd: "+ cooling time", cooktime: "25 mins", cooktimeschema: "25M", cookadd: "", difficulty: "Easy", serves: "12", ctaurl: "", today : "01/09/2019", description: "", keywords: "", cuisine : "Australian" } %} {% set category = { name: 'Lunchbox Ideas', uri: '/inspireandcreate/lunchboxideas' } %} {% block ingridients %}
  • 2 cups (300g) self-raising flour
  • ½ tsp ground paprika
  • 80g butter, softened
  • 6 slices champagne ham, chopped
  • 1 spring onion, thinly sliced
  • 1 tbs finely chopped chives
  • 1 cup (120g) shredded tasty cheddar
  • ½ cup (40g) finely grated parmesan
  • 100g fetta, crumbled
  • 1 Coles Australian Free Range Egg
  • 1 cup (250ml) milk
    • {% endblock %} {% block method %}
    1. Preheat oven to 200°C. Line a 12-hole, ⅓-cup (80ml) muffin pan with paper cases. Combine the flour and paprika in a large bowl. Use your fingertips to rub the butter into the flour mixture until the mixture resembles fine breadcrumbs. Stir in the ham, spring onion, chive, cheddar, parmesan and fetta.
    2. Whisk the egg and milk in a jug. Make a well in the centre of the flour mixture. Pour in the egg mixture and stir until just combined. Spoon the mixture evenly into the paper cases.
    3. Bake for 20-25 mins or until a skewer inserted in the centre comes out clean. Turn onto a wire rack to cool completely.
    {% endblock %} {% set nutri = false %} {% block nutriblock %}

    NUTRITION INFORMATION (per muffin)
    Energy 1037kJ Cals 248 Protein 11g Fat 13g Sat Fat 8g Sodium 557mg Carb 20g Sugar 2g Dietary Fibre 1g

    {% endblock %}
